gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy rwmwvqwry kQw subwh mrIc bDh jgX sMpUrn krnM smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Raamaavtdare Kathaa Soubaab Dareech Badhah Jagya Sanpooran Karanan Samaaptam||
translation: End of the description of the story of the Killing of MARICH and SUBAHU and also the Completion of Yajna in Rama Avtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of the Swayyamvara of Sita :

gurmukhi: rcXo suXMbr sIqw ] mhwN su`D gIqw ]
transliteration: Rachyo Suyanbar Seetaa|| Mahaan Suddh Geetaa||
translation: The day of the Swayyamvara of Sita was fixed, who was extremely pure like Gita.

gurmukhi: ibDM cwr bYxI ] miRgI rwj nYxI ]96]
translation: Her words were winsome like those of the nightingale. She had eyes like the eyes of the king of deer.96.
The chief sage Vishwamitra had heard about it.

gurmukhi: lXo sMg rwmM ] clXo Drm DwmM ]97]
transliteration: Layo San Raamannd|| Chadyo Dharam Dhaamannd||97||
translation: He took with his Ram, the wise and beautiful Youngman of the country and went (to Jankpuri), the abode of righteousness.97.

gurmukhi: suno rwm ipAwry ] clo swQ hmwry ]
transliteration: Souno Raam Pidare|| Chalo Saath Hamdare||
translation: “O dear Ram, listen, accompany me there;

gurmukhi: sIAw suXMbr kIno ] niRpM bol lIno ]98]
transliteration: Seeaa Suyanbar Keeno|| Nripan Bol Leeno||98||
translation: “The Swayyamvara of Sita has been fixed and the king (Janak) has called us.98.

gurmukhi: qhw pRwq j`eIAY ] sIAw jIq l`eIAY ]
transliteration: Tahaa Praat Jaeeai|| Siaa Jeet Laeeai||
translation: “We may go there at day-dawn and conquer Sita;

gurmukhi: khI mwn myrI ] bnI bwq qyrI ]99]
translation: “Obey my saying, now it is upto you.99.
“With your beautiful and strong hands, break the bow;

gurmukhi: sIAw jIq Awno ] hno srb dwno ]100]
transliteration: Seeaa Jeet Aano|| Hano Sarab Daano||100||
translation: “Conquer and bring Sita and destroy all the demons.”100.
